content.body:
Running https://wpt.live/service-workers/service-worker/registration-iframe.https.html in Safari on an iOS 16.0 device, I notice it’s all fail — with this error message:
> undefined is not an object (evaluating 'navigator.serviceWorker.getRegistration')
In macOS/desktop Safari, those tests all pass.
Is this some known issue with SW on iOS?
I tried some searches but couldn’t find anything relevant.

content.body: Hey annevk! We discussed some of the pending beacon stuff internally, and reached two possible alternatives to how to follow the feedback make it more fetch-extensible: https://github.com/WICG/pending-beacon/issues/70#issuecomment-1506373481. Would love to hear your thoughts now that it's more settled.
content.formatted_body: Hey annevk! We discussed some of the pending beacon stuff internally, and reached two possible alternatives to how to follow the feedback make it more fetch-extensible: https://github.com/WICG/pending-beacon/issues/70#issuecomment-1506373481. Would love to hear your thoughts now that it's more settled.

content.body: Hello! Out of curiosity. Can anyone from Google answer what is the state of the Workers throttling feature? I found that kDedicatedWorkerThrottling is simply disabled. https://source.chromium.org/search?q=kDedicatedWorkerThrottling&sq=&ss=chromium
I think you have answered your own question?
I just would like to know the reason, why it's not enabled :)
silly question... is there a reason/rule as to why sometimes the if'ing in the spec uses switch and sometimes it's just words?
so like here, there are switch conditions and then inside one of those are more conditions, but just in text
is there a reason that _shouldn't_ or at least couldnt be like this instead?
content.formatted_body: is there a reason that shouldn't or at least couldnt be like this instead?

content.body: (ignoring for a moment if I made a mistake in converting for the purposes of this example for a minute :))
I guess it would be pretty hard to read if you had to put "or" between 30-word conditions
Using switches more is possible, I guess
Ms2ger: you're saying you'd prefer to read the second one? If so, me too and I'm wondering if there is a reason it _shouldnt_ be like that... I guess it's mainly a question to the main editors
content.formatted_body: Ms2ger: you're saying you'd prefer to read the second one? If so, me too and I'm wondering if there is a reason it shouldnt be like that... I guess it's mainly a question to the main editors

content.body: I think the first one would be worse if it wasn't a switch
I don't care strongly between 1 and 2
Hi Is it possible to make a suggestion to the html consortium?
* is there a reason that _shouldn't_ or at least couldnt be like this instead? Domenic annevk
content.formatted_body: * is there a reason that shouldn't or at least couldnt be like this instead? Domenic annevk

m.new_content.body: is there a reason that _shouldn't_ or at least couldnt be like this instead? Domenic annevk
m.new_content.formatted_body: is there a reason that shouldn't or at least couldnt be like this instead? Domenic annevk
